Can you explain why it's perfectly fine to use an i-address as the actual name of an ID when creating a new currency?

Actually, it's not recommended to use an i-address as the actual name of an ID when creating a new currency. This is because using an i-address as the name of an ID can cause problems whenever an i-address or name may be used, and will not be supported for creating currencies. The naming system will also be expanding the set of characters that will not be allowed for currency registrations to reduce user confusion.

## Limitations in multi-currency to be aware of:
1. (GUI and CLI) You will not be able to make a currency from an ID that has a properly encoded i-address as its actual name, not its calculated ID. Generally, the advice is “don’t do that”. Using an i-address when referring to a currency will only be interpreted as referring to the currency or identity which has that i-address calculated based on its name registration. As a general rule, making an ID with an i-address as its name is not prevented by the protocol, but will cause problems whenever an i-address or name may be used (many cases) and will not be supported for creating currencies. To reduce any potential for user confusion, even though the naming system provides will also be expanding the set of characters that will not be allowed for currency registrations.2. (GUI) If a currency is supported in the Verus Desktop already, such as BTC or ETH, you will not be able to use those same named currencies as a PBaaS chain. This limitation is considered errata for this testnet release and will not be a limitation before mainnet availability.## Testnet Reset
The testnet was deleted and relaunched on this release. **IF YOU HAVE LAST LAUNCHED VRSCTEST FROM A VERSION PRIOR TO THIS, PLEASE DELETE THE FOLLOWING DIRECTORIES BEFORE RUNNING THIS NEW UPDATE:**
**Linux:**
```
~/.komodo/vrsctest
```**MacOS**
```
 ⁨Users⁩/⁨{YourUserName}/⁨Library⁩/⁨Application Support⁩/⁨Komodo/vrsctest
```**Windows**
```
"%APPDATA%"\Komodo\VRSCTEST
```# Disclaimer
What if I want to create a PBaaS chain with the same name as a currency already supported in the Verus Desktop, such as BTC or ETH? Is that possible?

No, that's not possible in the current testnet release. If a currency is already supported in the Verus Desktop, you won't be able to use the same name for a PBaaS chain. However, this limitation is considered errata for this testnet release and will not be a limitation before mainnet availability.

## Limitations in multi-currency to be aware of:
1. (GUI and CLI) You will not be able to make a currency from an ID that has a properly encoded i-address as its actual name, not its calculated ID. Generally, the advice is “don’t do that”. Using an i-address when referring to a currency will only be interpreted as referring to the currency or identity which has that i-address calculated based on its name registration. As a general rule, making an ID with an i-address as its name is not prevented by the protocol, but will cause problems whenever an i-address or name may be used (many cases) and will not be supported for creating currencies. To reduce any potential for user confusion, even though the naming system provides will also be expanding the set of characters that will not be allowed for currency registrations.2. (GUI) If a currency is supported in the Verus Desktop already, such as BTC or ETH, you will not be able to use those same named currencies as a PBaaS chain. Do I need to delete any directories after updating to the new version of Verus?

Yes, if you've launched Verus from a version prior to this update, you'll need to delete specific directories before running the new update. The directories to delete vary by operating system: for Linux, it's `~/.komodo/vrsctest`; for MacOS, it's `⁨Users⁩/⁨{YourUserName}/⁨Library⁩/⁨Application Support⁩/⁨Komodo/vrsctest`; and for Windows, it's `"%APPDATA%"\Komodo\VRSCTEST`.

Using an i-address when referring to a currency will only be interpreted as referring to the currency or identity which has that i-address calculated based on its name registration.
